results:
Based on the search results, I can provide you with comprehensive information about The Little Prince-related museums, theme parks, attractions, tourism sites, memorials, and commercial products in France:

## Theme Parks and Attractions

### Le Parc du Petit Prince (The Little Prince Park)
The main attraction is a medium-sized amusement park themed around The Little Prince, located near Ungersheim in Alsace, eastern France, sitting on 23 hectares totally devoted to Saint-Exupéry.(no content)Two helium balloons allow guests to discover the world of The Little Prince from at least 150 metres in the air.(no content)Among the 31 attractions based on the theme of flight, there are no roller coasters or scary rides.(no content)The park features balloon flights, carousels, roller-coasters, playgrounds, shows and petting zoo.(no content)The AEROBAR gives customers the opportunity to sip a drink some 35 metres above the ground.(no content)In 2023, The Little Prince Park price for adults was 24€ and for kids above 1 meter - 19€, with kids below 1 meter entering for free.

### Petite France Theme Park
There's also a theme park themed on The Little Prince novel that consists of a memorial to Saint-Exupéry, a gallery, an exhibition of French houses, and various shops, with performances such as music box demonstrations, puppet theatre, and magical mime shows.

## Museums and Exhibitions

### Musée des Arts Décoratifs (MAD) - Paris
The Musée des Arts Décoratifs featured an eight-room exhibit "An Encounter with the Petit Prince" with more than 600 of Saint-Exupéry's newspaper clippings, poems, watercolors, photographs, and sketches.

### Atelier des Lumières - Paris
An immersive experience "Le Petit Prince: L'Odyssée Immersive" uses next-generation video projections and spatialized sound, with images covering walls and floors to create a 360° universe.(no content)Prices start from 13€, free for children under 3, with a 1€ discount for online bookings.

## Commercial Products and Merchandise

### Le Petit Prince Store - Paris
Located near Boulevard Saint Germain in the heart of the Latin Quarter, Le Petit Prince Store – Paris is the first official Little Prince shop.(no content)The store offers books, mugs, posters, cards and everything related to the little prince and his author.

### Foundation and Commercial Activities
The Little Prince transmits its values through a foundation, products, an official boutique and a family theme park.(no content)The Antoine de Saint Exupéry Foundation For Youth was created in 2009 under the aegis of the Fondation de France.

## Global Impact and Tourism
Saint-Exupéry's timeless classic has been translated into more than 270 languages and sold over 150 million copies around the globe.(no content)Since its publication in 1943, The Little Prince has become a global phenomenon with over 300 million copies sold and is the most translated book with more than 600 official versions.

These attractions and commercial ventures centered around The Little Prince have created a significant tourism ecosystem in France, honoring both Antoine de Saint-Exupéry's literary legacy and his contributions as an aviator.
